text: I love comfort cafe off Starcrest in that little shopping center area I forgot the name of the center.
Comfort Cafe was really good.
Mi Tierra for Breakfast? A lot of people say that place sucks altogether.

Blanco Cafe (the one on Blanco) has great enchiladas too.
There's a food truck that goes around called 3B BBQ.
Good list but I would add a torta ahogada from Roho Pork and Bread ðŸ¥–

Paloma Blanca on Broadway has great ceviche and a great atmosphere.

Thai Dee has the best glass noodles, I forgot what it's called, I've ever had!
Curry Boys BBQ, just not something you'll be likely to find elsewhere

Two Pocha is far better in Selma.
Leche de Tigre is just so good and so unique
Tre Trattoria behind the art museum and Jardin next to the arboretum.

La Fonda on Main. The menu is a collection of enchiladas you wonâ€™t often find, particularly in one place.

Lot of good choices so far but you can't forget Tip-Top on Fredericksburg rd.
Henry's Puffy Tacos (on Bandera) is, at least for me, the gold standard
Go to the original Ray's Drive Inn to try it.
Marias Cafe off nogalitos for breakfast tacos, very underrated
Original Blanco Cafe on Fredericksburg.
Chris Madrid's, my favorite burger spot in the city
I thought so too until I tried Diane's Diner.
410 diner has always been a favorite for me, with their pan fried fish, some unique sidishes like their Sonoma casserole, and their amazing mushroom artichoke soup.

If I had to pick one, it would be Restaurant Claudine.
Schiloâ€™s on Commerce Street (downtown) but itâ€™s only open for breakfast and lunch.
Station Cafe near Caesar Chavez.
Taco Palanque on 410 also slaps for greasy TexMex
You have to try Myung ga won best Korean place here

You might also want to try some Panaderias, if you havent. Also, Paleterias, there are many, some also with street food/snacks (210 Ice Cream). One staple here is El Paraiso, which is where people buy popsicles for fundraisers and to sell at parks.
Also adding in Birria Kings and if you're a Mexican candy/chamoy person, Chamoy Dreams food truck (which is next to Birria Kings) and stock up at Alamo Candy with stuff to take with you.
If you havenâ€™t been to Back Unturned micro brewery, go there.
Salt Lick BBQ in dripping springs.
